ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I developed the ability to write more academically in Spanish as well as improving my writing in Spanish overall. I also developed more confidence in my ability to speak Spanish in any situation. I also improved my grammar in Spanish as we were taught grammar and practiced a lot.
I learned how to write correctly in Spanish, and how to correctly use accents.
Spontaneous conversations in Spanish, corrections on grammar and spelling, presentation skills
Developed skills in grammar and knowledge.

I gained a greater confidence in my writing and speaking abilities as a result of taking this class. I am of Hispanic descent and speak Spanish at home but I never felt confident outside of limited conversations with loved ones. This class has expanded my knowledge about issues in Latin America, especially in socio-political spheres. I loved the projects in the class which allowed me to study more about my own culture as I learned about issues from other Latin American countries.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The class is great overall for Spanish heritage speakers. However, one weakness is that I would have liked more practice reading in Spanish.

This course was very informative and tailored to the needs of the students in the class, so what we were learning in class was topics we needed to improve on. There is a lot of small work for this class, but this helps you not lose the knowledge. Helpful feedback is also returned very quickly.
The course is over all very strong and an encouraging environment to learn
I can't identify any weaknesses, this class was incredibly engaging and have notably improved my ability to speak and engage with the Spanish language.

Strengths: The class is structured into little groups where 2-4 students help each other complete various activities, from translation exercises or recounting the previous night's reading or video. This allows for all students to uplift each other and creates a strong sense of comradery between students.
Weaknesses: Although I enjoyed watching videos and movies for homework, the class could incorporate more media in the class itself. We could watch clips as a whole to introduce a new topic and write about different interpretations or opinions on the topic.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course for Spanish heritage speakers. This class is fit for this group as it is a lot of practice on stuff that this group already knows.
I would definitely recommend this course because no matter what level of Spanish you are coming in with, the class will be tailored so that you can get the most out of it.
Yes, everything about it was so comfortable and engaging. I looked forward to coming to class.

Yes, if the student is considered a heritage learner of Spanish. This class not only allows for a greater understanding of the Spanish language but also provides students insight into issues and happenings across Latin America.
